Reviews.Title: “Great location. Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FLORIDAOJ
Reviews.Content: We spent week of Thanksgiving in Paris. This hotel has great location, very helpful staff, and reasonably priced. I understand the old staff was replaced.We would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and location but a bit worn out”
Reviews.Author: princesskaty
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a twin room with my daughter for 3 nights. First impressions were good with reception helpful but lift was out of order and we were on 5th floor so had to use the tiny winding staircase. Staff carried our 2 20 kg cases up! Room was clean but covers and carpet were frayed and faded. Bathroom was a little dusty. Breakfast was fresh and reasonable selection. Wifi available most of the time. Overall good value budget hotel in a great location with street Market nearby

Reviews.Title: “Think twice”
Reviews.Author: Robbie2604
Reviews.Content: I booked into this hotel as friends had also booked in. We checked in and no mention was made of the fact that the lift was broken...on checking the internet, it turns out it's been broken for over 1 year. We had to drag out luggage up 3 floors. No offer of assistance was forthcoming. My room was tiny....you had to turn side on to get into the bathroom - the space between the bed and bathroom door was maybe 10 inches.. You also had to sit side-on on the toilet, as there was maybe 3 inches between the seat and the heater. The room was claustrophobic. Access to the free wifi was spasmodic, and mostly inaccessible. I spoke to the afternoon staff and they reset it, and access was possible for 1 hour before it crashed again. I spoke to the morning reception staff (Alicia) this morning, and she rudely told me that she had no idea if it was fixed and that couldn't (read: wouldn't) check if it was working. I asked her if I could use the communal computer, and when I did, I again couldn't access the internet. When I raised it with the receptionist, she rudely told me that she couldn't help me (again read: wouldn't). I asked her if it was possible that I needed to turn something else on, on the computer in order to access the net, and she turned and walked away from me. I was furious. I reminded her that I was a house guest, that was paying for the "pleasure" of staying in the hotel, and in fact paying her wages....her reply "What?" and I repeated myself and said that being abusive was unacceptable,.....and she just walked away. I left the hotel, found another one, and when I came back, she was yelling at another house guest, who responded in kind. She's the wrong person for a hospitality job.... The hotel is basically an overpriced dump.....there are far better places just around the corner....with polite staff, breakfast, working wifi, and lifts.....use them...(Hotel Jardin de Villiers)

Reviews.Title: “A Russian orphanage in Siberia is cleaner and better to stay at, trust me, I’ve done it.”
Reviews.Author: denvertraveler06
Reviews.Content: I’m gonna start with the positives: 1. Cheap 2. Great location! Really close to the subway station and in a lovely Parisian neighborhood with an awesome street market on the weekends and great little stores open during the week. Now, it’s dirty and run down. I chose this hotel because it was cheap, reviews were ok and I figured for the first trip to Paris, we’re not going to be in the hotel room anyway. But I wasn’t prepared to put up with mold all over the bathroom. The bathroom heater wasn’t working, the heater in the room was barely working, how could it work, it looked like it’s been abused. It was dirty and rusty. The bed uncomfortable and the top blanket clearly not washed ever. My pillow was more like a bag of clumpy rice, than a pillow. After two days in the first room given to us, I asked the front desk to fix the heater in the bathroom. They gave us another room, which was nice. So room number two had a terrible dirty carpet, it’s not been washed ever, let alone vacuumed. The bathroom there was better, but the situation with the pillows and the blanket on the bed the same. They didn’t change the sheets every day and one day ran out of towels to give us. Yep, no clean towels. In both rooms, the walls and pretty much everything was visibly dirty. I didn’t look for it, promise, it was just in my face. I am not a clean freak, but I asked my husband to walk around with socks on trying not to pick up some gross disease. People clearly stay there, clearly put up with it. But maybe because they’ve pre-paid and have nowhere else to go. Yuk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay for young couples”
Reviews.Author: Mia K
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed here with my boyfrend and we had a great time here. It is nice small hotel and great value for money. It is on great location, near metro station and cca 20 min from Montmartre for me best romantic place in Paris :) All staf speak english...The room was cleaned every day and new towels also provided everyday. We really had pleasant stay in this hotel and we recommend it to all young couples :)

Reviews.Title: “Average value for money but original feel of Paris”
Reviews.Author: midest6
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three weeks. The hotel was not my choice but was booked for me from my agency. The rooms are small but normal for Paris. The price is expensive for this kind of a place but again this is the norm in Paris, meaning that you can not get a better deal for this kind of money. The staff shows the typical Parisian controversial attitude, sometimes friendly, sometimes neutral and sometimes not caring at all. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels also provided everyday. The walls are made literally out of paper, since i could hear my colleagues talking over the phone two storeys above (not to mention more intimate encounters..). The breakfast is ugly. A generous buffet full of ready-made junk food. During the three weeks i stayed here, there were days that the buffet emptied and there was not reserved food for the guests. WiFi is crappy and if you want real internet you have to pay...There is a small fridge so at least i was buying fresh fruits and real juices. The good thing about this hotel is the location. Wagram is a typical Parisian neighborhood with not so many tourists and one of the places to get an original feel of Paris. Around the corner is a lovely market with all kind of things to buy and lots of cafes and restaurants to eat. Next good thing is the metro and bus which is located very close so moving around Paris is effortless. Montmartre is within walking distance- about twenty minutes max, so one can get the sights but not the crowds. I usually stay in the center of Paris but if i have to come again i will consider this neighborhood as an option and if i am close to desperate, maybe this hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Access to the real Paris life, cages, street shop and friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: Ruvall
Reviews.Content: A great value for the money! Helpful and curteous staff, a short walk to the metro, and all of Paris. I felt as I really lived in the neighborhood, even got to know staff at the local cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, clean and nice stay -”
Reviews.Author: SriniSadasivam
Reviews.Content: We booked 2x 4 bed family room thru Hotwire (prepaid) for 4 nights and when we we checked we are offered two-connecting rooms with individual baths. Wow! that was a pleasant surprise. First time in Paris and cant speak single french word except 'merci'. Lol. The staff ( a lady) received us well (it was raining when reached Paris) and check-in was a breeze. There was young man during night shifts and in total the staff were pleasant, English speaking, willing to chat, offer advices, gave metro maps, explain directions. What else you need? Rooms were small (like all european hotels - except few Rome/Florence hotels) but very clean. They have inbuilt safes which we actually used. No air-conditioning but we did not need it as the temperature moderate. Kept the windows open and no street noise. We loved the location and it was 5-10 min walk from Villiers (line M) metro. Safe to walk 24x7 and nothing to be afraid of. Lively neighborhood and there was a Saturday flee market in the nearby street. Lot of restaurants, corner bistros, grocery shop and we were so happy about the location, hotel and the price. Free breakfast included the tariff and no complains. Boiled egg, pastries, cereal, meat etc ( we dont eat meat still enjoyed the BF which was enough and you don't go hungry) In a nutshell, I was bit worried about my non-refundable prepaid booking for a Parisian boutique hotel but we were totally happy.

Reviews.Title: “when can we come back”
Reviews.Author: julie p
Reviews.Content: we were a little apprehensive after reading other reviews .on our arrival were greated by a very nice member of staff who talked to us for a whlie told us about the metro and gave us map then showed us to our room which was basic but clean and had everything we needed .the staff were all pleasent throughout our stay and were always willing to chat and advice . this hotel was in a great location to get around paris we had a great week their and would go back and recommend to friends and family thanks for helping to give us a great holiday julie and fred page

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to rate although definitely not the best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gem-urban
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July 2011. We normally stay in pretty nice 4 or 5 star hotels however I knew in Paris we would be doing so much sightseeing we'd hardly be in the room so decided to go for a cheaper basic hotel. This is exactly what it is. It's fairly clean but could be better. Staff weren't extremely rude as said on previous reviews but still could definitely be friendlier. So overall wasn't really terrible as we went with fairly low expectations. On a good note we found the beds extremely comfortable. Weird to have good quality mattresses it seemed when the rest was seriously basic! Good location however very near metro.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place. They can't even make a wake-up call.”
Reviews.Author: enrgizerbunnie01
Reviews.Content: Terrible! Find another hotel because this one for a little less is not worth it. All of the accommodations it says it comes with does not actually come with the room. The wireless internet didn't reach our room on the second floor so we had to sit in the lobby with our computers to search for attractions ect. The hairdryer looked like a tiny vacuum cleaner and hardly dried your hair. There were no alarm clocks in the room. The bathrrom had mildew, and you could feel all the springs in the beds. I wouldn't mind if it were a simple and clean room, but what really tipped the scales was that the front desk kept saying they would wake us up with a wake up call and they kept forgetting everyday except for one day! On the last day the of course forgot again and if my friend didn't miraculously wake up bu herself we would have missed our flight back to the USA! When I stressed how we needed our call that morning they said they didn't know who was responsible and didn't seem to care. They just tried shooing us out to our shuttle and we were already running late! I would honestly try other ptions before you try staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the naysayers... GREAT value”
Reviews.Author: jk5996
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I took a trip to Paris in May of 2011. This was my first trip out of the USA and frankly I am used to the large posh accommodations you find in cheap US hotels. I booked this hotel online after extensively reading reviews as it was one of the few within our budget and honestly I was terrified as to what we may have been getting ourselves into. Upon check in I was pleasantly surprised. Yes the hotel seems slightly outdated and offers little in the way of amenities but possesses a sort of simple charm . The room was small (as i expected) but very clean and we found the beds to be very comfortable. The area itself and the hotel were both very quiet and the staff was friendly enough. The area around the hotel is just wonderful, large street markets, resurants, cafes, stores ect were all around the area and it is within a 5 minute walk of the Villiers metro line, making it extraordinarily easy to get around Paris quickly (even for two people who have never ridden a subway). Stay away from the minibar as it will cost you about $5 for a single 12oz can of soda. Overall I found this hotel to be an amazing value as it was one of the cheapest I found and after staying for 8 nights I could not understand all of the negative reviews. Unless you are a spoiled aristocrat or extremely picky and fussy there is no reason not to appreciate this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Neda453
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very weary and tired. The building needs complete refurbishment. 220 Euro per night was exteremly high for this hotel. Very low standards. Room was vey hot and stuffy. No ventilation system. This price didn't even include breakfast . We asked for a taxi at 8.00 am but they told us they can't book a taxi before 10.00 am which was strange. Do not recommend it at all.

Reviews.Title: “bad rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: johnnywr1
Reviews.Content: the bathroom and the toilets was not good.too small room.too expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: susieqz_8
Reviews.Content: Great location in the 17th near the rue de Levis pedestrian shopping street and a large Monoprix (grocery) as well as many other stores. Of course, close to the Villiers metro. Hotel is basic, but clean. An excellent value for Paris. I'm neutral about the staff, they were competent. If you are looking for a basic, clean hotel at a good price in Paris this is it. Internet only on one station in lobby, with no printer. Staff could arrange airport shuttle if needed. Cheapest from CDG airport is the Roissybus (Opera bus) to Opera and then #3 metro (several stops only ) to Villiers, then short walk to the hotel. I favor the Opera bus, then taxi (about ten euros) right to hotel instead of the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdique1048
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the hotel on May 14, 2011, we were quite happy. We were welcomed by an English speaking gentleman. Our arrangements were in order at the desk and we were quite happy with the room. The bathroom was clean, the towels were replaced daily and the room was very clean. We never ate breakfast at the hotel. A good breakfast is always available on Rue Levi around the corner. The staff were very friendly and we will recommend to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, adequate & worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: urij
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our stay here. The staff is polite and helpful, and the rooms are budgety but worth it. The location was amazing! The hotel is in a perfect location - around the block from a market street with bakeries, fruit & vegetables, coffee houses and even a super market! It's a 5 minute walk from the Villiers Metro line (number 2), 10 minutes walk from the Monceau park, and 20 minutes walk (if you feel like walking instead of taking the Metro) - from Arc de Triomph! The area a quiet, and so is the hotel. I aprreciated the fact that the lobby has free wifi, plus free access to a computer so you can check your emails, sites etc. However, the Wifi doesn't really work in the rooms. Breakfast is with an extra Fee so we just got Baggetts and stuff nearby. The rooms are pleasent - the tv wasn't working but we were told that soon the tv's will have free satelite service. The rooms have heating but aren't air-conditioned, so the winter is nice but I don't know how bad it is in the summer. There is a free safe in the room, plus a minibar you can use for free storage. The bathroom is ok but there's no bathtub - just a shower with a curtain, which was annoying because the water wets the whole bathroom floor. Last - The bed was on wheels, which was pretty annoying cause it easily glides, which was annoying. Other than that, the hotel is defenitely adequate worth the money if your on a budget, and will suply you a pretty pleasent stay, in a very good location.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Room not great.”
Reviews.Author: FunTravel4119
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, metro, shops, restaurants. Staff very friendly. Our twin bed room, however was most uncomfortable. You could feel the mattress springs, cardboard pillows, rug filthy. Shower head broken, no soap or glasses provided, safe didn't work. I don't expect much in an inexpensive hotel, but felt this was really less.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJM28
Reviews.Content: Service was appalling. On arrival around lunch time we were advised the room (double) was not ready and to return in a few hours. We returned about 7pm and was advised that there was a problem with the room - the lights were not working. We were told either stay in the room without lights or have two singles. We were also offered a room within the 'sister' hotel around the corner. This hotel was old, dirty and not at all acceptable, not worth the money paid.We are not fussy people but - we just couldn't stay there. Location is nice has a small market and shops, but that was spoilt due to problems experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,needs refurbish, but great location”
Reviews.Author: branit
Reviews.Content: Expected less than we got for the money. Room was small, jaded decor and bed covers but after a day, decor became irrelevant. Room was clean and adequate for purpose. Mini bar poorly stocked but it kept our water cool! Fan provided to keep room cool at night, and it did. En suite also clean and serviced daily.Hotel staff were courteous, helpful, spoke English.Didn't book breakfast as part of deal so dined out. Hotel is short walk from Metro in lovely part of Paris. Local area is busy by day with street market in full swing, and good interesting shops aplenty. Easy to do touristy things by day in city centre and return on foot or by Metro at night. Wonderful public park closeby. Dined in The Village pub/restaurant nightly and found it particularly enjoyable, busy at night, good atmosphere. Hotel has luggage room to hold bags if required for the day,if early arrival/ late departure flight time.Hotel did appear to overbook for one night and guests were unimpressed when they arrived, but staff dealt with issue professionally, had another local hotel available and appeared that guests were satisfactorily accommodated without fuss. Liked location most and having to go home least.

Reviews.Title: “On the plus side, it's in a great spot....”
Reviews.Author: MLParker
Reviews.Content: Found hotel room to be slightly grimey; mini bar fridge looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. Also maid came in and made beds but, failed to empty bins despite them overflowing. TV wasn't working in our room and when we asked at reception was told that in some rooms they didn't and there was nothing he could do about it (or, in other words he couldn't care less) Carpets also dirty and furniture looked about 40 years old; bed also horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: TravelandCoffee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel because of the price, but we were happily surprised by the convenience of the area. There is a market street nearby, a supermarket and a pharmacy so you have everything you need. The Metro stop is nearby and you can even walk to some peripheral historic sights. I highly recommend Le Petit Canon if you are looking for a great meal nearby (only 1 block away). The staff is indifferent but fine. No one was particularly friendly or went out of their way to help us. The hotel was very clean, but we were left with no towels after one housekeeping visit. I went to the basement to ask for more towels and was told that there were none left and was given tiny bath mats to use for towels. Beyond that, the bar is not really functional and never staffed and there is only internet access in the lobby. I am on the fence about recommending this restaurant just because the price is certainly right. We spent very little time in the hotel and a few tiny inconveniences didn't really put a damper on our trip to this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: licahil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to Metro and market .Also short walk to Moulin Rouge,and to Champs Elysees.Hotels itself is nothing fancy ,rooms are not big ,but they are OK for Paris standard. The furniture in rooms is outdated hotel does not have too many amenities except a lounge but no swimming pool or fitness facility. I cannot complaint for price but some guestes where complaining they paid almost 200 Euros for a night which I would never pay for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A VG+ Hotel value and EX service, location was very nice w/ plenty to do nearby”
Reviews.Author: LW-in-CA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an outsanding value given Paris and the hotel location. Located right adjacent to a local marketplace full of specialty shops and vendors. Quite charming and convenient! Only grouse was the facility is somewhat older and perhaps could use a refurbish soon, but that would bump up the costs to visitors, wouldn't it? All told is fine, solid feel, a very good continental breakfast buffet, QUIET (older hotels have nice thick walls!) and the wifi service EX when used in the Lobby. Thick & solid walls block street noise & wifi signals very well, so in-room reception was virtually non-existant - so what's perfect? Would recommend to those who appreciate good service and value.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Glacier National Park of Canada, Canada
Reviews.Title: “Why would a 3 star hotel have pullout beds?”
Reviews.Author: Darrin_Marshall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awful. We arrived late and were greeted at the door. The guy told us he was expecting us and that we should go down the road and to the left to go to the sister hotel. This was strange. We get there and the lobby looked respectable and looking at the rates on the wall, we noticed that these rooms had a kitchenette and that they were 230 euros a night. We thought as long as we get the price we booked for, this is going to be awesome. It wasn't. First, the bed was a pullout which was very uncomfortable. Second, the advertised "air conditioning" was a fan. Third, the road in front of the hotel was quite noisy. Fourth, the internet never worked. Lastly, the pots and pans actually had thick mold growing on it. Simply put, this place is awful. Don't even consider it. I know the people here who have budget in mind are thinking just to suffer it out. One night? Maybe. Just save a little extra from that next paycheck and get a decent room somewhere else. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Budget 3-star hotel with nice receptionists”
Reviews.Author: iambodin
Reviews.Content: From "Vilier" metro station, few steps could led me to Rue de Levis. And then just 1 right turn from rue de levis, hotel is easily recognised in quiet street of Rue Le Bouteux. All is about 200 metres from Vilier metro station. Above all, Rue de Levis is beautiful street. Lots of shops, markets, patisseries and monoprix (very friendly supermarket and accept credit card). Receptionists are helpful, polite. When I said "quiet", I meant it. Hotel is located at one of the heart site of paris but incredibly quiet and private. Room is acceptable. Let me say I've got a bit more than I'd paid. Pauline Frommer's guidebook had warned me to prepare my mind about size of room in paris. So its size is appreciately acceptable. Beds are clean, well-made. Furnitures are (too) simple and few. Power inputs are adequate. Bathroom is simple but comfortable. Shower head and controller can be easily manipulated. Hair dryer is included. The only thing that I dislike is the floor of bathroom and bedroom is continuously connected. No step or bar to block water on bathroom floor from carpet invasion and hard to prevent wet carpet after showering, there is no plastic curtain at the bathtub for sealing all splash from shower head. Bottom line : This hotel is nice place and recommended for budget travelers who aim to discover paris and need a bit of luxurious place for relaxation after exhausted day.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable”
Reviews.Author: steph357
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris on a late-notice business trip and this was the only reasonably priced hotel provided to us by our office staff. After reading the other reviews, it didn't seem terrible so we went ahead and booked it. We were not pleasantly surprised. The rooms were small, which I expected based on the price and location of the hotel. It was the condition of the room that was terrible (see attached pictures). The comforter and curtains were old, dusty and disgusting. My pillows were slightly bigger than what you would receive on an airplane, did not have cases and were stained (I resorted to putting a t-shirt over the pillow to be able to sleep). The carpets were heavily stained. The hotel did not have air conditioning, so the windows had to be open (as it was 30+ C on the day of our arrival). The windows opened out to a courtyard so that you could see and hear everything from other rooms. One morning we woke up to no hot water in the shower. The hotel was loud. Every night there were guests coming home at 3-4 in the morning and you could hear every word they said. I think this is largely due to the thin walls and the rooms facing the courtyard. The backbreaker for me was the lack of friendliness of the staff. I heard them refuse to call a cab for several people, were not helpful in recommending area restaurants/things to do and they were rude when we mentioned the noise in the hotel. I have traveled in Europe, on business, quite a bit (at least 2 weeks a month, 9 months of the year) over the last four years and this was by far the worst hotel experience I have ever had. I would discourage anyone from staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel for budget savvy travelers”
Reviews.Author: devishaSF
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris during Christmas 2009, and picked this hotel based mostly on cost, even though the reviews were mixed. I loved our stay - it was maybe 100 feet from a very convenient metro stop, the closest main street has a large open air market every day, and the 17th arrondissement is busy, but not touristy - lending to some nice quiet restaurants all within walking distance. Hotel was clean, and safe. Shower was nice and hot. The one downside was the mattress - too springy. Staff was courteous and friendly. However, for the type of travelers that we are - interested in saving money on a hotel that we are just using for sleeping and showering - this was perfect. We didn't get the hotel breakfast, as the market on Rue de Levis has plenty of food and cafes. for $70/night, we found a great bargain. Granted, this is not the type of hotel where you want to stay in the hotel all day long, but it was perfectly suited to our needs. We also had free wifi (its in the lobby, but you can access it from some of the floors), so we were connected to home and maps for wherever we wanted to go!

Reviews.Title: “Why go somewhere else?”
Reviews.Author: Dalaik
Reviews.Content: I came back from paris just yesterday and the Villiers Etoile was once again the hotel of my holidays. I dont even think about going somewhere else. Ok, the rooms arent very big (but not tiny either) and from my room windows I could only see a back alley but my purpose was to see paris, not spend my days in the hotel looking out of the window. From this hotel you can easily reach (by foot) the Champs Elysees AND Montmartre, there is a subway station near, you have a street market, a couple of supermarkets, lots of restaurants and boulangeries, and also some very nice bars-brasseries in case you want to have a drink before returning to the hotel. Also,the staff was very kind and helpful. I m sure that the next time I ll go to Paris, I wont even think about going to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Awful Rooms”
Reviews.Author: catirra79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in July 2009 for a sight-seeing trip. The hotel is in an excellent location - about 5 minutes walk from Villiers Metro Station, and there are many bars, restaurants, supermarkets and shops within walking distance. It only about a 20 minute ride on the Metro to get to the major sights - Champs Elysees, Eiffel Tower etc. We found the reception staff to be friendly and helpful, and we were provided with fresh clean towels every day. However, the state of our hotel room was completely unacceptable. There were numerous stains on the carpet, the curtains were old and dirty, the bathroom smelt terrible and it was impossible to have a shower without leaving massive puddles of water in the bathroom due to inadequate drainage. There was also damage to our bathroom door. The rooms in this hotel need to be refurbished urgently - it was depressing after a lovely day sightseeing to return to a hotel room that felt so dirty and drab. This hotel is cheap for Paris, however that does not excuse the state of our hotel room. For this reason, I would definitely not recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service from deceptive staff in nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: borgetta
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days at this hotel in 2008 and were very happy with it because of the location, price and small, clean and well-kept room (although noisy, overlooking the street). What a difference a year makes! In Feb 2009, no electricity the first evening and through the night, even though everything else on the street was lit up. No hot water the first day. No hot water the second and third days. Various staff told us it would be restored "within the hour" because the plumbers were on the premises, then a new boiler was being installed, then they were checking the pipes, etc, etc. (BTW: the cold water coming out of the taps and shower was very very cold in February.) When we returned for our bags the afternoon of our third and last day, I overheard the staff asking someone on the phone (in very colorful French) "when are you going to get someone out here to fix the hot water? I'm sick of all the complaints". I asked for compensation; would have been happy with one day's credit. No way. Other problems: the mouse on the internet terminal in the lobby had been broken for so long it burned a straight line into the screen. How expensive is it to replace a mouse? After asking three different staff over two days for the iron and ironing board, all of whom told us they were out on loan, another staff person told us they didn't have an iron. Bottom line: BAD, BAD SERVICE FROM SEVERAL DECEPTIVE STAFF PEOPLE> DO NOT RECOMMEND.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay close to the action, yet in a non-touristy area.”
Reviews.Author: modeche
Reviews.Content: So while on our European journey '09, we unexpectedly decided to make our way to Paris. Having not the slightest knowledge of areas, tourist locations, etc., after a few hours of research, we settled on this hotel. It was an unexpected gem that far exceeded our initial expectations. Located within easy access to the Metro (underground subway system), it was refreshing to come "home" to our room in a non-touristy area after dealing with so many crowds when visiting the sites. Our twin room consisted of two twin beds pushed next to each other. There was a small fridge in the room, as well as a tv hosting French channels. Included in the price was a buffet breakfast, consisting of breads, croissants, cheese, some slices of meat, as well as an assortment of juices, teas and coffee. The bathroom was clean and our only thought of strangeness was to be found with the shower. Whenever the water was made to be warmer or colder, the entire shower head would move up and down its pole. It was extremely bizarre and I had never encountered anything like it. We were able to figure out a way to "secure" the hose portion of the shower head in order to avoid this from happening again. But the first times it happened, I screamed my head off as the water sprayed everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: lou_139
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my boyfirnd for the weekend. The staff were extremely rude and unhelpful on arrival and gave us the keys to probably the worse hotel room I have EVER stayed in. I have travelled all over the world and have stayed in far better youth hostels! The room was filthy, with a thick layer of dust all over the surfaces, the carpet was so disgusting that I wouldn't even walk on it bare foot. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall and was stained and dirty. Also the room was freezing because the radiator didn't work. When we told reception, they got quite stroppy and said they would send someone to fix it, but didn't. We asked again and got more attitude. Someone did come to fix itt but it broke an hour later! The only good thing about this hotel was the location. Good area and only 5 minutes from Villiers Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional service”
Reviews.Author: efred_D
Reviews.Content: In the middle of November '08 I had a very short trip in Paris together with my wife and our 2 year old son over the weekend. We spent one night in this hotel. We arrived at the hotel at around 12, the room was ready. Entering the room we found that in the toilet there was water spilling from the ceiling. Leaving the hotel we noticed the reception about the problem and we asked to do something. Coming back in the evening we received the same room. Nothing has been done there. In the morning we wake up with very bad smell coming from the toilet too. Most likely that wasn't simple water... :-((( When we left the hotel I complained at the reception and I didn't receive even a "Sorry". In my opinion a very unprofessional service, a no-go for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay, but beware”
Reviews.Author: mccannon24
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel in a great neighborhood. Small, but clean, comfortable rooms. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the metro and there are many good, reasonably priced cafes and restaurants right on your door step. My friend, who I traveled to Paris with, and I ate breakfast at this cute cafe every morning for under 3 euros. All in all, very good stay (we were here for 5 days), BUT BEWARE OF THE AIRPORT SHUTTLE! We heard from friends and other reviews that taking a taxi can cost 45-50 euro to take to the Orly airport. Being that, we booked the airport shuttle through the hotel for only 17 euro a person. To reserve the shuttle, we had to put 20 euro down in cash for the two of us. The hotel had our credit card number on file and I found it very strange that they would not let me reserve the shuttle on my card (first red flag). So, the shuttle arrived on time and it was a fairly uneventful ride to the airport. When my friend and I went to pay the remaining 14 euros, the shuttle driver demanded that we pay him 20 euro instead and was very rude to us. We explained that we already paid 20 and told him to call the hotel, which he wouldn't and said he did not have a phone. After refusing to pay the extra money, the driver proceeded to try and drive away with our luggage! HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! I'm not sure if the hotel was at fault or the cab driver, but either way we will not be staying in this hotel again because of this awful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel but dont do Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: ScottishFyfe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a short visit to Paris. Its location is good (a quiet back street) and only 2mins walk from the nearest metro. Staff are welcoming and the hotel is generally clean and kept to a good standard. We wouldn't recommend paying the extra for breakfast as the breakfast room is in the basement and the pasteries tasted like shop bought ones from Tescos- very dissappointing when you're expecting a fresh continental breakfast! A warning for the summer time- the room didn't have air conditioning so was uncomfortable at night in June temperatures. Overall the hotel was reasonable for the price (compared to others)

Reviews.Title: “Located in an excellent area”
Reviews.Author: Udaletraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this through a Eurostar package. The hotel is clean and friendly. It is located in an excellent area with a market selling fresh produce everyday. The breakfast was â‚¬9 each and pretty basic but there is lots of delicious food all around the area though lots of cafes & shops and the Villiers Metro station near by. All in all excellent value (although rooms are small, but I think that's just Paris) and the location is a big plus. Michael, West Cumbria, UK

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean, but don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: shanellek
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a weekend away with my boyfriend, and found this hotel to be clean, with friendly (English speaking) staff. It is fairly well located with a street market literally one street away, as well as Monoprix and Metro nearby. Apart from that, you really need to do quite a bit of travel on the Metro to get to places - which is fine as the Metro is close and easy to use. We found that a lot of the additional facilities advertised by the hotel were "not available" - which could have been a stroke of bad luck? Safe, pay movies and room service were all not working. This hotel is fine if you are looking for a basic, clean place to stay in Paris, however next time I would probably look to stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, really nice area”
Reviews.Author: passport1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two friends, all of us in single rooms. Rooms were small but that's expected (singles smaller than everything else). Hotel was clean, statff was friendly. Nice continental breakfeast. It's in a great neighborhood, not touristy at all. The roon was very quiet. Only a couple of minutes away from the metro stop, so even though it's a ways out, it was easy to get to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: UkTraveller43
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in one of the most delightful parts of Paris, the 17th. arr. Have stayed in other hotels in this area and this is the best value of them all. Very friendly staff, good buffet breakfast and in a quiet street two minutes from the Metro. Bedrooms are small but so are all budget hotel rooms in Paris. (I payed 75 euros per night for a double room.)

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant place”
Reviews.Author: PaolinFurioso
Reviews.Content: The unique good thing there, is the location and the neighborhood... Very close to the Metro, with nice shops and charming streets all around. The hotel was bad. The foresaw check in was at 1.00 p.m., but we had the room at 3.00 p.m. Nobody cared at the reception. Employees almost rude and careless. Rooms are probably designed by the same architect of Lilliput... The smallest rooms I have ever seen in my life. It's impossible to turn around the bed with opened windows, you've to jump on the bed to be able to pass over...I wonder how is it possible to get the permission to receive guests in such a small space. When we've got the room there was a plastic shower haircap abandoned in the bathroom and hanged to the wall (!). Sensation of dirty carpet and bed cover. No satellite TV. Breakfast room under the ground level, close to the toilets.When we left there was a taxi-drivers' strike. Nobody known it... We asked the receptionist where to catch the Airport Terminal Bus... Unable to respond. I will not remember it as a good experience. Definitively, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Great City!!”
Reviews.Author: elduque
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay at this conveniently located hotel. The Paris subway system is unparalleled in ease of use, and this hotel is so close to the Villiers station where the "2" and "3" lines meet. Down the street is a daily outdoor market as well as the Monoprix supermarket. The rooms were very small, but the bed was comfortable and the shower hot and strong. What else can you want? There was a safe in the armoire (very handy) and a mini fridge. Don't expect luxury. The TV only has 5 free channels, all in French. We went in the fall so A/C wasn't an issue. The front desk staff was very helpful. No language barrier whatsoever. All in all, it was quite serviceable, if not slightly overpriced by American standards.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: fancyhalfpants
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Paris for 5 nights prior to the stay at Pavillon Villers. We wanted an inexpensive little hotel to save some cash for fun. We got the "little" and a little more. Here are the points we encountered: The Good: - Location is 3 blocks to metro, 2 blocks to velib stand, and around the corner from shopping. - Great little neighborhood, not very touristy which we liked much more than staying by the Eiffel. - Non smoking rooms - Staff was very nice and English friendly - Sheets seemed clean although not washed everyday. The Bad: - The interior room windows face other rooms and provide not an ounce of privacy for sound or sight when open and we didn't feel that our shade covered them appropriately either when closed. - The window coverings are thick opaque plastic with a tattered cloth cover so there is no natural light unless you want to display your room and yourself to 10 other guest rooms about 15 feet away. There is no option for a light curtain. - The rooms are very small - which we expected for an inexpensive European hotel so this wasn't horrible. - The bath has no real cover so when you shower water is hard to keep confined to the tub area. - Breakfast was so-so, no pure vegetarian options. If free it will suffice to most. - No hotel restaurant - but we didn't care because we usually don't partake anyway and there are restaurants on the street. The Ugly: - The rooms are in desperate need of an overhaul. I should be grateful that they are in bad shape because it allowed the low price, but it was uncomfortable. - The double bed was two twins (I am usually ok with this) but they were both sunken and hard so there was no "crossing the line" easily. I think this is the case with all "doubles" as they were permanently joined. - Anything permanent in the room that wasn't easily wiped down felt gross. ie: curtains, carpet, top bedspread. They are just way too old for a hotel.... stains, wear, etc. Do not believe the photos. Overall - we paid $75 USD (deal on Hotwire) and were fine with the stay because it was a nice cute neighborhood and the service was just fine. We saved the $100+ a night to spend on great food and amazing clothing which was more fun than hanging out watching tv in our room anyway! This hotel however is not a 3 star...... not even in European standards.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and quaint in a delightful way”
Reviews.Author: AllordVacation
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel. Reception desk spoke very good English and were very friendly. Met our every request (AC adapters, questions) quickly and accurately. Very close to Villers Metro station (5 min walk) making central Paris and attractions/sites just minutes away. Also a Monoprix (grocery and dept type store) very close on Rue de Levis. Also, the street market on nearby Rue de Levis is awesome! Check out the fromagerie (cheese) and Paul's boulangerie (bakery). Bed was comfortable. Bathroom small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Emily0717
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel as a part of a package through Go-Today.com (a great company to work with, highly recommend!) The best part about this hotel is the location. Villers is such a great neighborhood; I truly felt I had the authentic Parisian experience, mingling with the locals by staying here. The metro is super close. A safe, relatively quiet neighborhood. The hotel is what it is. The rooms are a little cramped. A little dank. But as a budget traveler in Europe, our expectations were not grossly elevated. The room was sufficient. The bed was not uncomfortable. The receptionists were helpful. If you want four star, book four star. If you want hotel for a good value in a quaint neighborhood, stay at Pavillon Villiers Etoile. My husband and I took the advice of the Trip Advisor reviewer who recommended La Gondole, the Italian restaurant in Villers. It was THE BEST meal we had in Paris. The owner was indeed gracious and hospitable and energetic. Generous portions -- we got a 3-course meal for 19 euros each.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-”
Reviews.Author: dulceamor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the BEST location! It is very close to the Metro (Villiers), the street market and the Monoprix supermarket as well as nice restaurants and little shops. We walked to the Basilica du Sacre ( a long walk but worth it!) The staff -specially David was helpful. Breakfast was nice- cereal, yogurt, all types of breads, cheese, croissants, juice, tea and coffee. Over all our stay was great- we would stay at Pavillion Villiers Etoile again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Great Neighborhood!”
Reviews.Author: GoMariners
Reviews.Content: For a three star hotel this place is great. We had a room on the ground floor right by the courtyard and enjoyed it a lot. There was an included breakfast which was very good... fruit, yogurt, cerial, croissant, pastry, juice & coffee. Just down the street was rue de Levis where there is a daily market. This is a great neighborhood with a lot of locals and few tourists. A nice escape after a day of sightseeing! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place!”
Reviews.Author: nescafequeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights (4-8 August 2006) for our wedding anniversary. We were a little worried about our stay after reading some of the negative reviews about it. But, all I can say is that this is a lovely hotel and we had no complaints at all. We had a double room (actually 2 single beds made into one) but it was comfortable and to be honest, we could have slept on a clothes line after the amount of walking we did! The room was small but clean. The maid came every day and gave us fresh towel and refilled the toilet roll & tissues. The reception staff were all lovely (we met about 4 different people I think) and tried their best to help. It's a great location, right next to Villiers Metro station. We also walked to Arc de Triomphe and Montmartre/Scare Coeur from here. It felt very safe in this location, including late at night. We found a lovely little restaurant on Rue des Batignolles (main road near the hotel). It's called La Gondole and is an Italian place place run by a lovely French man who really went out of his way. He speaks good English although I spoke French to him to practice! We had a main course, dessert and wine for 13 euros each and the portions were huge - really tasty too! We went back to him as we enjoyed it so much. All in all, this is a great place to stay and we recommend it as a good base for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: kerreye
Reviews.Content: When you pay 55 Euros a night for a double room in a hotel in a good location in paris you can't expect a lot. We were pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The rooms were a decent size, everything was clean, good location and the staff were generally helpful. The hotel is quite noisy and there was no air con.... but... for the price what can you expect. Basically, if you are a group of young travellers go for it, but if you are a family or of an older generation, you won't get the peaceful holiday you are probably looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: sailersaturn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It is located on a quiet side street next to a wonderful street market with a large selection of food and other items. We really enjoyed having metro access with a 5 min. walk from the hotel. It was extremely clean and the staff was very friendly. We never felt unsafe walking back to the hotel in the evening. We would DEFINITELY stay here again!

HotelInfo.Name: Pavillon Villiers Etoile
HotelInfo.Address: 6 rue Lebouteux, 75017 Paris, France
